And don’t think about asking for even the possibility of changing anything up in your role cause then they will give you the boot

headline: Good Company, but not revolutionary
pros: The company has an amazing culture and vibe. The people you work with are all high level, competent, intelligent, creative. The salary and benefits are really good.
cons: I was part of the first hires during the expasion  time of the company and there was a lot of mistakes during that time. We were hire as "trainees", doing door to door sales, with the promise that will grow in the company really fast. Which wasn't true. They also sell the idea of breaking with big banks and really care about the small client when in the reality they act in the same way and you are ask to push the company and sell at any cost, even when it's clearly not good for that client to come to the company.

headline: A ton of bright minds, a few more tons of problems to solve
pros: You have the chance to work in a cool environment with some bright people trying to solve actual problems.
cons: They move fast, and break things in doing so. There's always a few problems that you are working on to solve.

cons: Very bad for career, you may get fired anytime without any logic reason. The salary is average few than others companies.

headline: Maybe worth your bet in a few years when is a true company and not a giant failing startup
pros: You will have heaps of work, so yes, you will learn. Besides that it is a casual and young  workplace. Not much more.
cons:
1) There are no processes. Company is currently a mess and employees are paying the bill for a terrible management. People work really hard, minimum 2-3 extra unpaid hours a day because everyone is overloaded.
2) Salary is really below the market average.CEO explanation is "we pay less so people get motivated to break through and outstand". Being honest, even if you do so you won't be paid a penny more unless you rebel.
3) Employees do their part and the company don't value them. Forget about compensation or bonus, long term partners will eat it all in stock options and give you a half-salary maybe.

headline: Great to learn not good to live
pros: A good place for learning, if this is your first job you will learn a lot from the beginning, good structure and they are always trying to improve their system for the internal use
cons: Not a place for a career plan... you must be prepared for a lot of pressure to deliver results, the company doesn’t have the feedback structure they promised

headline: Great company

headline: Bad Place to Work!
pros: Learn about the Brazilian payment market.
cons: The company is confused about been a StartUp or a real company, total absence of leardership, very poor HR area, low salaries, IT and Security aren't treated with the due respect and importance. There's no career opportunities, only if you are friend of the leaders or owners.
